name: Prickly Hornwort

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: fork-divided three or more times, thread-like, round in cross-section, , whorls of 5-12, relatively stiff even out of water, smooth margins
Flowers: June-September, minute in leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: prickly fruits on female plants only, several spines of various lengths along margin, rough surface
Habitat: Tolerates cool temperatures and low light
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
